channel.title: The Straits Times Singapore News
channel.description: The Straits Times - Get exclusive stories, in-depth analyses and award-winning multimedia content about Singapore, Asia and the world.

item.title: Coronavirus: NGOs step in to help migrant workers at smaller housing facilities
item.description:
April 24, 2020 10:34 PM

SINGAPORE - With an inter-agency task force moving quickly to address the needs of migrant workers in big dormitories, the challenge now is to look out for migrant workers in smaller housing facilities as they are scattered all over the island in groups of varying sizes.

item.title: Coronavirus: Dorm operator gets stern warning from MOM for forcibly confining workers
item.description:
April 24, 2020 10:26 PM

SINGAPORE - A dormitory operator who forcibly confined 20 workers in a locked room had been given a warning from the Ministry of Manpower (MOM).

item.title: Coronavirus: 400 patrons turned away for not following stricter entry limits at popular markets
item.description:
April 24, 2020 10:11 PM

SINGAPORE - Just over 400 people were turned away on Friday morning (April 24) for not following stricter entry limits at four popular markets, said the National Environment Agency (NEA).

item.title: Family of otters frolicking outside Mustafa Centre is looking for a permanent home
item.description:
April 24, 2020 9:14 PM

SINGAPORE - As the country enters the third week of its circuit breaker period and with most people cooped up at home, animal residents unbound by safe distancing rules are taking this opportunity to explore urban spaces now empty of humans, as they have never been able to do before.

item.title: Singapore flag projected on Switzerland's Matterhorn in show of solidarity during coronavirus
item.description:
April 24, 2020 7:03 PM

SINGAPORE - The Singapore flag was beamed on to the Matterhorn on Friday (April 24), the latest in a series of nightly light shows at the Swiss peak that project hope and solidarity during the coronavirus crisis.

item.title: Coronavirus: SingPost postpones new stamp issues; no impact on existing stamp purchases
item.description:
April 24, 2020 6:36 PM

SINGAPORE - All new national stamp issues from April to June, as well as the Tokyo Summer Olympics stamp issue, will be postponed, said SingPost on Friday (April 24).

item.title: Coronavirus: Employers urged to support workers' mental well-being during outbreak
item.description:
April 24, 2020 6:33 PM

SINGAPORE - Employers can check in at least once a week with their employees who are working from home due to safe distancing measures.

item.title: Coronavirus: Flouting safe distancing measures, abusing enforcement officers will not be tolerated, says Masagos
item.description:
April 24, 2020 6:12 PM

Those who think "it is fun" to flout safe distancing rules could end up being infected and infecting others around them as well, he said.

item.title: Evening Update: Today's headlines from The Straits Times on April 24
item.description:
April 24, 2020 6:09 PM

Good evening! Catch up on some of the main headlines on Friday, April 24.

item.title: $135,000 raised for ST and BT charities; third version of Stay At Home, Singapore launched
item.description:
April 24, 2020 6:09 PM

SINGAPORE - Two weeks after the catchy remake Stay At Home, Singapore was released, the kindness and generosity of Singaporeans has seen more than $135,000 raised for children and youth from low-income families.

item.title: Coronavirus: More NCID patients being placed in prone position to help them breathe better
item.description:
April 24, 2020 6:02 PM

SINGAPORE - Patients lying face down on their stomach in hospital beds have needed less oxygen support than those lying on their back, a discovery which has prompted the National Centre for Infectious Diseases (NCID) to place more of its patients in the prone position.

item.title: Coronavirus: Courts will continue to hear only essential and urgent matters till June 1
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:06 PM

SINGAPORE - The courts in Singapore will continue to hear only essential and urgent matters until June 1, in tandem with the one-month extension of the circuit breaker measures to slow the spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: Coronavirus: 46 donors contribute $458,000 to new relief fund to help SIT students in need
item.description:
April 24, 2020 4:53 PM

The university said that the student relief fund will give out grants of up to $2,000 to each recipient to cover living costs and school expenses.

item.title: MOH suspends officer who allegedly leaked number of new coronavirus cases in S'pore, reviews its processes
item.description:
April 24, 2020 3:52 PM

The 35-year-old civil servant is a Singaporean woman and was arrested under the Official Secrets Act and Computer Misuse Act, the police said on Thursday.

item.title: Business booming for smaller online grocers, seen as alternatives to big supermarket players
item.description:
April 24, 2020 3:48 PM

Some, however, had to close off orders entirely for the time being after an overwhelming surge in demand.

item.title: Coronavirus: Slow business, supply issues hit small minimarts and provision shops, but mid-sized outlets see boom
item.description:
April 24, 2020 3:40 PM

SINGAPORE - In Mr Faisal Mohamathu's minimart in Tanjong Pagar, tinned foods and instant noodles fill the shelves, while bags of rice and toilet paper are neatly stacked at the back.

item.title: 897 new Covid-19 cases in Singapore, taking total to 12,075
item.description:
April 24, 2020 3:11 PM

It is the first time in five days that new daily infections have fallen below 1,000.

item.title: Sufficient safe shelter capacity for the homeless during circuit breaker: Desmond Lee
item.description:
April 24, 2020 2:32 PM

These shelters, called Safe, Sound Sleeping Places, are run by 35 organisations.

item.title: Coronavirus: STB provides $22m to help tourism businesses prepare for recovery; more help for travel agents
item.description:
April 24, 2020 1:44 PM

SINGAPORE - The Singapore Tourism Board (STB) has set aside $22 million to help tourism businesses market their services and build demand for when global travel resumes.

item.title: Coronavirus: From a virtual 'teach-in' to online trivia, scientists and activists take outreach programmes online
item.description:
April 24, 2020 1:43 PM

SINGAPORE - Nature walks and science talks may be off the cards during the circuit breaker period, but scientists and activists in Singapore are taking their efforts online, offering free activities that people can undertake at home.

item.title: Coronavirus: All six local universities will let fresh graduates continue learning for free to access more jobs
item.description:
April 24, 2020 1:21 PM

From May, 16,000 fresh graduates will be able to take four continuing education and training modules offered by their alma mater for free.

item.title: Man charged with spitting in a public place and using criminal force on public servant
item.description:
April 24, 2020 1:10 PM

Shake Mohammed Abdul Samad Haji Abduraheem is now facing three charges under the Covid-19 (Temporary Measures) Act 2020.

item.title: Coronavirus: 85 Singapore residents evacuated from Saudi Arabia as country suspends all commercial flights
item.description:
April 24, 2020 11:55 AM

The group includes 40 students studying in Saudi Arabia and their dependants.

item.title: Coronavirus: Singaporean to plead guilty to leaving home about 30 minutes before period of isolation ended
item.description:
April 24, 2020 11:38 AM

If convicted, Tay Chun Hsien faces up to six months in jail and a fine of up to $10,000.

item.title: HDB resale and rental volumes down, prices stagnant amid Covid-19 outbreak
item.description:
April 24, 2020 9:31 AM

SINGAPORE - Resale and rental volumes of Housing Board flats fell in the first quarter of 2020 amid the ongoing coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Morning Briefing: Top stories from The Straits Times on April 24
item.description:
April 24, 2020 7:40 AM

Good morning! Here are our top stories to kick-start your Friday, April 24.

item.title: Coronavirus: What can Singapore do to minimise risk of infections in new weak links?
item.description:
April 24, 2020 6:00 AM

 As Singapore extends its circuit breaker by another month, new weak links have emerged in the three-month fight against the coronavirus. Here is a look at what can be done to minimise the likelihood of infections.

item.title: Coronavirus: Dorm operators working closely with Muis, Government to support Muslim foreign workers during Ramadan
item.description:
April 24, 2020 6:00 AM

New prayer mats and essentials for breaking fast, such as dates, will also be provided.

item.title: Covid-19 patient dies after he is found at hospital staircase landing
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A coronavirus patient who was found motionless at a staircase landing at Khoo Teck Puat Hospital yesterday morning later died from his injuries.

item.title: Who can apply for traineeships?
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Q Do I qualify for a traineeship?

item.title: Sing along to Home tomorrow to thank front-line, migrant workers
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

In a national effort to keep spirits up and thank front-line and migrant workers amid the circuit breaker period, an islandwide singalong to well-loved song Home will take place at 7.55pm tomorrow.

item.title: Tighter coronavirus curbs: Motor, transport firms face bigger blow
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

The one-month extension to circuit breaker measures could have a devastating impact on the motor trade and the transport sector, both of which are already reeling from a downward spiral in demand.

item.title: Coronavirus: Jail for man who breached stay-home notice to eat bak kut teh
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A man who breached a stay-home notice (SHN) and went out to eat bak kut teh on March 23 amid the coronavirus outbreak was sentenced yesterday to six weeks in jail.

item.title: Coronavirus: ComfortDelGro taxi rental waiver extended by another month
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Taxi giant ComfortDelGro will extend its full rental waiver to its cabbies by another month following news that safe distancing measures will be tightened and extended till June 1.

item.title: Groceries on wheels in five HDB estates
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Residents in five mature housing estates will not need to travel far to buy groceries, thanks to an initiative dubbed FairPrice on Wheels.

item.title: The Big Story: Interview with Minister Masagos Zulkifli
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Minister Masagos Zulkifli talks about people who flout safe distancing rules and how will the Muslim community observe Ramadan amid the circuit breaker.

item.title: Four more dormitories under isolation
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Four more foreign worker dormitories have been placed under isolation, bringing the total to 25, even as coronavirus cases from these dorms continue to drive up infection cases here.

item.title: Two charged with verbally abusing public servants during coronavirus outbreak
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Two Singaporean men have been charged with verbally abusing public servants in separate incidents during the coronavirus outbreak.

item.title: Coronavirus: President Halimah calls on Muslims to support one another
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

President Halimah Yacob has asked Muslims in Singapore to support one another throughout the fasting month of Ramadan, and conveyed her appreciation for their community efforts.

item.title: Coronavirus: SIA says 15 staff tested positive and nine have fully recovered
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Singapore Airlines (SIA) has confirmed that 15 staff have tested positive for Covid-19 since last month, with nine having fully recovered and been discharged.

item.title: Man escapes death after apex court acquittal
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A 27-year-old man, who was originally handed the death penalty for driving his friend to pick up drugs, escaped the gallows yesterday after he was cleared by the Court of Appeal .

item.title: Coronavirus: Task force aims to boost support for spouses facing abuse at home
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

The inter-agency task force addressing violence within families is looking to strengthen support for spouses facing abuse at home, especially amid the extended circuit breaker period.

item.title: Civil servant arrested for leaking info on number of virus cases
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A civil servant has been arrested after she allegedly shared the number of new Covid-19 cases in Singapore with members in a private group who were not authorised to receive the information.

item.title: Lawyer accused of perverting course of justice, hindering police work
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A lawyer, suspended in 2018 for the offensive way he cross-examined a molestation victim - by referring to and staring at her breasts - has allegedly run afoul of the law.

item.title: Thinner crowds at markets with new entry rule
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Crowds at four popular wet markets have thinned in the past two days after stricter entry measures were implemented, the National Environment Agency (NEA) said yesterday.

item.title: Coronavirus: Two new cases at separate nursing homes raise concerns
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Two new cases of Covid-19 have surfaced at two nursing homes, again raising concerns about the vulnerability of senior citizens to the disease.

item.title: 58-year-old lorry driver killed in 3-vehicle accident
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A traffic accident on Tuesday night - involving a lorry, a taxi and a car - left one dead and three others injured.

item.title: Coronavirus: At least 350,000 in Singapore still commuting to work daily
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

At least 350,000 workers in Singapore are still commuting to work daily, even after the number of services considered essential was reduced on Wednesday to further control the local spread of the coronavirus.

item.title: Risk of coronavirus spread in 'blind spots' and potential clusters in Singapore
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Some commonalities of these vulnerabilities include crowded areas, places with high human traffic, "forgotten" sectors and those who live in a semi-closed community.

item.title: Loan sharks use new tactic to harass debtors
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Even with circuit breaker measures in place, loan sharks have found a way to pester people who owe them money.

item.title: Coronavirus: Use jobs support aid to pay staff or lose future payouts, MOM warns employers
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

The Ministry of Manpower (MOM) will investigate complaints that employers are not using their Jobs Support Scheme payouts to support employee salaries.

item.title: Mega Covid-19 facility coming up at Tanjong Pagar Terminal
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A large facility being set up at Tanjong Pagar Terminal could house up to 15,000 Covid-19 patients or foreign workers, as the number of coronavirus cases in Singapore continues to increase, The Straits Times has learnt.

item.title: March core inflation falls to minus 0.2% amid coronavirus woes
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Inflation was down again last month - a trend that is likely to continue for some time as the pandemic takes a toll on the global economy.

item.title: 1,037 new cases, 982 of them in dorms
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Foreign workers living in dormitories continued to make up the bulk of new coronavirus cases, with 982 such workers among the 1,037 new cases yesterday, the Ministry of Health said in its daily update.

item.title: Family has been getting help, and will continue to do so: MSF
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

A family of six that was reported as having been left with $200 for three weeks has been - and will be - getting a range of assistance from the Government and various community partners.

item.title: Financial institutions continue to offer internships, jobs
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

Financial institutions are continuing to offer internships and jobs to tertiary students amid the coronavirus crisis to help graduates find employment in this difficult economic landscape.

item.title: NUS offers 1,000 traineeships, jobs to grads
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

The National University of Singapore (NUS) will give a leg-up to its graduates by opening up 200 full-time jobs and 800 paid traineeship positions across its faculties and research institutes as well as in administration.

item.title: Thousands of traineeships for fresh ITE, poly and uni grads
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

The paid traineeships supported by the Government are being offered by over 280 companies and organisations.

item.title: Universities use tech to deter cheating in online exams
item.description:
April 24, 2020 5:00 AM

At least two universities here are turning to technology to send students into a "lockdown" when they take online examinations - to prevent them from cheating.
